postLists.content:
Dear Students,

Please be informed that your Term 2 Practical Exam will be conducted as per the schedule. The exam will be conducted in two parts:

Biology- Experiment 2 To identify the slides of Plant Tissue (Parenchyma, Sclerenchyma) and Animal Tissue ( Nerve Tissue and Muscular Tissue)

Chemistry- Experiment-5: To determine the melting point of ice and boiling point of the given sample of water.

Experiment-6: To verify the law of conservation of mass in a chemical reaction.

Physics- 1) Establishing the relation between the loss in weight of a solid when fully immersed in

a) Tap water

b) Strongly salty water with the weight of water displaced by it by taking at least two different solids.

2) Determination of the density of solid (denser than water) by using a spring balance and a measuring cylinder

One of the above practicals will be demonstrated by the teacher during the exam.
You are required to observe carefully and fill in the Observation Sheet with the following:

* Aim

* Observation / Inference

* Result

* Precautions (if any)

Part 2: MCQ-Based Written Test (15 Marks)

You will answer Multiple Choice Questions (MCQs) of 15 marks based on all Term 1 practicals:

* Physics â 5 marks

* Chemistry â 5 marks

* Biology â 5 marks

Schedule for Science practical exam

9A- Chemistry

9B- Physics

9C- Chemistry

9D- Biology

9E- Chemistry

9F- Biology

9G- Biology

Regards

postLists.content:
Dear Parents and Students

The 9th edition of Pariksha Pe Charcha (PPC), the unique interactive programme of the Honâble Prime Minister with students, teachers, and parents, is scheduled to be held in January 2026.

To select participants for PPC 2026, an online Multiple Choice Question (MCQ) based competition is being organised on the MyGov portal (https://innovateindia1.mygov.in/) from 1 December 2025 to 11 January 2026. Students of Classes 6 to 12, teachers, and parents are eligible to participate. All participants will receive a Participation Certificate. (CBSE circular attached)

This competition serves as the platform through which students, teachers, and parents may submit their questions for consideration. Selected questions may be featured in the programme.

Let us come together to celebrate the Utsav of Examinations, PPC 2026, inspiring students to embrace learning with joy, confidence, and curiosity, and shaping them into the nation builders of tomorrow.

Regards

Team GDGPS

Young CEO Program

ThinkStartup, in collaboration with TIDES (Technology Incubation & Entrepreneurship Development Society, IIT Roorkee), is offering an opportunity to participate in the Young CEO Program, a four-day entrepreneurship bootcamp hosted at the Research & Innovation (R&I) Park, IIT Delhi.

This program is designed for students interested in innovation, problem-solving, and building real-world ventures. Participants will work with startup founders, IIT entrepreneurs, faculty members, and industry experts to develop an idea from concept to execution.

Program Details
Venue: R&I Park, IIT Delhi
Dates: 26–29 December 2025
Timings: 9:30 AM to 4:30 PM
Fee: INR 16,500 + GST
Registration Link: https://bit.ly/K_NCR_DEC25

Key Benefits for Students
• Develop a real business idea and create a complete business plan
• Pitch ideas to angel investors in a Shark Tank–style finale
• Learn from entrepreneurs and industry mentors
• Chance to be featured on YouTube
• Certificate in Entrepreneurship (ThinkStartup & TIDES, IIT Roorkee)
• Letter of Recommendation supporting college applications

Interested students can register using the link above.

Happy Learning!!
Career Guidance Cell

*GoSharpener is honoured to extend a meaningful opportunity for students of Classes 9, 10, 11, and 12* to participate in a powerful awareness initiative organised by *PETA India.*

PETA India is hosting a symbolic demonstration to raise awareness about the cruelty faced by elephants used for rides, entertainment, and captivity. Students will help create a strong visual message encouraging society to choose compassion over cruelty.

*Participants will be provided with grey T-shirts, trousers, geometric masks, and symbolic chains to represent the hardships elephants endure.*

*Event Details*

ð Date: 9 December 2025

â° Time: 12:00 p.m. â 1:00 p.m.

Location - Jantar Mantar, Sansad marg, Connaught place, New Delhi

*Exclusive Benefits for Participating Students*

â¨ Certificate of Participation

ð Goodies / Merchandise from PETA India

ð¸ Media Mention of the organisation and participating students

ð± A meaningful civic engagement experience promoting empathy and animal welfare

GoSharpener encourages interested students from Classes 9â12 to join this impactful demonstration and stand for kindness, compassion, and a more humane world.

Warm Regards!

Reminder

Those going for school trip need to submit their copy of aadhar card today for sure.

CT

VVM update for Level-ll qualifiers

All selected students are requested to update or install the Level-II Exam App from vvm.org.in.
Please remember that the exam will be conducted only through the app. Do not attempt to log in through the website to take the exam.

Students may appear for the Level-II exam on 19th November or 23rd November.

Important Notes:

  • Students who have qualified for Level-II can download their selection certificate from their VVM portal.

  • All eligible students have already been informed through their registered email ID.

  • Students appearing for Level-II are advised to change/update their password to prevent any misuse of their login credentials.

Dear students 
kindly complete the preview question 

Click and watch the link given below. Answer the question that follows. https://youtu.be/i5WYp4wMXfc?si=QLu5b6n1CdbAMZ39

Q. Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam is remembered as a great leader, both in science and as President. What leadership qualities do you think he had?

About the author:

 

NAME:  A.P.J Abdul  Kalam (Avul Pakir Jainulabdeen Abdul Kalam). 

DOB: 15 October 1931      DOB-27 July 2015

Background:  He was an Indian aerospace scientist and statesman who served as the 11th president of India from 2002 to 2007.

He was known as the Missile Man of India for his work on the development of ballistic missile and launch vehicle technology.

postLists.content:
Dear Students,

Please be informed that your Term 1 Practical Exam will be conducted as per the schedule. The exam will be conducted in two parts:

Aim 1:
To prepare:
a) A true solution of common salt in water
b) A suspension of mud in water
c) A colloidal solution of starch in water

Aim 2:
To prepare a mixture and a compound using iron filings and sulphur powder, and distinguish between them based on physical and chemical properties.

Aim 3:
To carry out the following chemical reactions and observe the changes:
a) Iron nail with copper sulphate solution
b) Burning of magnesium ribbon
c) Heating of copper sulphate crystals
d) Reaction between sodium sulphate and barium chloride
e) Reaction between hydrochloric acid and zinc metal

Part 1: One of the above practicals will be demonstrated by the teacher during the exam.
You are required to observe carefully and fill in the Observation Sheet with the following:

Aim

Observation / Inference

Result

Precautions (if any)

Part 2: MCQ-Based Written Test (15 Marks)

You will answer Multiple Choice Questions (MCQs) of 15 marks based on all Term 1 practicals:

Physics â 5 marks

Chemistry â 5 marks

Biology â 5 marks

Regards

Dear Students,

Sharing sample notebook for Term 1 work completion. Please go through it carefully and use it as a reference to complete your own notebooks. Ensure that all topics are written neatly and systematically, as notebook submission carries marks.

Remember, this sample is meant to guide you—your work should reflect your own effort and understanding.

Regards,
Deepti Rai

Sample Notebook Work - Term 1

Dear students ,

This is regarding Term 1 practical exam , you will be given only 1 experiment either from physics , chem or Bio you have to learn and perform in the lab & write observation & result on the answer sheet. 
MCQ ( Total 15=5 each) will cover all three physics, chemistry and biology. 

You will be intimated well in advance before the practical exam by the Time table team that which section will go to which lab.

Lab files submission of term 1 for correction  by teachers on 29th sept . 
MNM monitors of each class will collect & keep them in the labs . Teachers will coordinate with the MNM incharges.
Regards

Dear students 
kindly refer to the schedule given below:

The SDG GoSharpener Toolkit for September is Here!

Sustainable September: Nurturing People, Planet & Possibilities! 
 

As September unfolds, we celebrate the interconnectedness of our environment, health and innovation! The GoSharpener September Toolkit is filled with engaging, hands-on activities that foster environmental stewardship, well-being and forward-thinking in young changemakers.
 

This month, we spotlight days that inspire awareness and action, such as:
International Day of Clean Air for Blue Skies
World EV Day
 World Rivers Day
 National Nutrition Week

Each activity is carefully curated to cultivate curiosity, care and commitment towards a healthier, greener future.
 

 September Toolkit Link:
https://gosharpener.com/posts/1040033
 

Together, let’s empower the next generation to thrive with purpose and protect what matters most.


Warm Regards,
Team GoSharpener

Dear Students,

This is a gentle reminder to submit your AI notebooks for Term 1 with the following topics completed as it carries marks for internal assessment:
- Data Literacy 1 worksheet
- Self Management Skills Worksheet
- Python Loops
- Python Lists
- Minimum 15 Python programs listed in the notebook
 Please ensure your work is neat and up to date before submission.
Along with this note, I am also attaching a Question Bank with Suggested Answers for your reference. You are advised to go through it and practice well in advance for both the AI Practical and Theory Exams of Term 1.

Timely completion and regular practice will help you perform confidently in your exams.

Best wishes,
Deepti Rai

Find the attachment for practical and revision schedule

Dear all
Kindly completee the questions from 'The snake and mirror'.

 

PREVIEW:
write your reflection on how fear can cause people to change.

About the Author


  • Vaikom Muhammad Basheer (1908 –1994) was a Malayalam fiction writer from the state of Kerala in India.

  •  He was a humanist, freedom fighter, novelist and short story writer.

  •  He was noted for his path-breaking, down-to-earth style of writing 

 He has been honoured with several awards, including the Padma Shri in 1982

Reference to Context:

"I looked into the mirror and smiled. It was an attractive smile. I made an important decision—I would shave daily and grow a thin moustache to look more handsome."

Questions:

  1. What decision did the narrator make while looking into the mirror and why?

  2. How does this statement reflect the narrator's vanity?

Dear Students

Reminder!!!
Bring Mathematics Practical file tomorrow.

Dear Students ,
PFA .  Kindly complete . 

COMPARATIVE ANALYSIS

Q. Differentiate between collenchyma, Parenchyma, and Sclerenchyma.

 

Features

Parenchyma

Collenchyma

Sclerenchyma

Nature

It is a living tissue and has abundant cytoplasm.

It is a living, flexible tissue.

 

It has abundant cytoplasm.

It is a dead tissue as protoplasm is absent.

Cell wall

Thin cell wall, made up of cellulose

Thin cell wall, made up of cellulose, but cell wall also has irregular thickening made up of hemicellulose and pectin.

Highly thick cell wall made up of lignin which crushes the protoplasm.

Cell shape

Isodiametric, polygonal.

Isodiametric, polygonal.

Variable

Nucleus

Present

Present

Absent

Intercellular spaces

Maybe present

Absent

Absent

Occurrence

The most abundant plant tissue. Present in all soft parts of the plant like covering of the plant parts, internal tissue etc.

Found in branches and twigs.

Found in tough and hard parts of the plant such as the seed coat, pulp of certain fruits such as guava and pear 

Modifications and Types 

Modifications : 

1.Aerenchyma: Parenchyma tissue that has large air spaces or cavities within them are called Aerenchyma.

 

It provides buoyancy to aquatic plants, helps them to float on water. 

 

2.Chlorenchyma:

The parenchyma tissue which is rich in chloroplast is called Chlorenchyma. 

 

It helps to perform photosynthesis.

Modifications:

1.Chlorenchyma:

The collenchyma tissue which is rich in chloroplast is called Chlorenchyma. 

 

It helps to perform photosynthesis.

TYPES:

Depending upon shape, it is of 2 types:

a.Sclereids

 

b.Sclerenchyma fibres

Function

Storage of substances.

 

Provides buoyancy to aquatic plants such as lotus.

Performs photosynthesis.

It's a living mechanical tissue, it provides flexibility to the plants.

 

It prevents the twigs and branches from breaking in case of high winds. 

It provides mechanical strength.

 

Protection from stress and strain.
